result.execSummary:
The defendant Santos Martinez-Mercado was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by May 9, 2017. Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of  a civil judgment.

**Restitution is set at $0 (zero).**
No contact with Walmart, Home Depot or Pick & Save in complaint.

As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 100 days in the House of Correction on case #15CM991.  Report date: November 16, 2015 by 5:00 p.m. Huber release for work and program at UCC ONLY.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes: Successfully complete (50) hours of community service.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Santos Martinez-Mercado

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Check Packet

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant sentenced to serve 100 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 (zero) days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   As a condition of probation, the Court ordered
          the defendant to serve 100 days in the House
          of Correction on case #15CM991.  Report date: November 16, 2015 by 5:00 p.m. 
          Huber release for work and program at UCC ONLY:
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or
          use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   No contact with Walmart, Home Depot or Pick & Save in complaint.
     *   Successfully complete (50) hours of community
          service. 
     *   No firearms; dangerous weapons.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by May 9, 2017. 
          Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due 
          immediately or an entry of  a civil judgment.
     *   Restitution is set at $0 (zero).
.
Pretrial Incarceration Credit; received and filed.
Sworn as Spanish interpreter: Enrique Barbosa.

Defendant Santos Martinez-Mercado in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.
Justice Point Program report dated November 6, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Santos Martinez-Mercado in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense waives use of Spanish Interpreter for purposes of today's proceedings.  Case scheduled for final pretrial.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court orders jury trial date converted to plea and sentencing date.  Case adjourned to Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

15RM045241  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
10/02/2015
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR NEXT SCHEDULED HEARING.
Spanish interpreter: Enrique Barbosa contacted the Court.

Attorney Eduardo M. Borda in court, defendant Santos Martinez-Mercado not in court, in custody and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defense counsel has received discovery, but no offer.  Defense counsel requests speedy jury trial. Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by the final pretrial date. Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Speedy Jury Trial, Branch 37.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.

JusticePoint Discharge Summary Report, received and filed.

*Defendant in custody on new case 15CM2953*

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no alcohol.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Home Depot
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.

Defendant Santos Martinez-Mercado in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Santos Martinez-Mercado in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Sworn as interpreter:  Enrique Barbosa
  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney T. R. Williams for Gabriela A Leija in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. Court will not forfeit any bail.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

04/20/2015

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by defense counsel that defendant has been in court all morning, went outside, and hasn't returned.  Defense requests to adjourn case to the afternoon.  Court grants request. Case adjourned to 04-22-2015 at 1:30 pm
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with HOME DEPOT.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING AND ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Sworn as interpreter:  ALEXANDRIA WIRTH.

Defendant Santos Martinez-Mercado in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Santos Martinez-Mercado in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant HAS A LOWER PENDING CASE AND is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to BRANCH 46 FOR BRANCH 37.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
